Please enter the following information about this Customer Level.

if yes, then if the customer enters a valid promotion, that promotion discount will be applied to the ENTIRE ORDER, ON TOP of any level extended prices and level discounts. If no, then these customers are not allowed to enter promotion codes.
if yes, then all customer orders for this level will have $0 tax charged, regardless of their address.

if yes, then percentage customer level discounts will be applied ON TOP of level extended prices. If no, then if an extended price exists for a product, that price is used as is.  Amount discounts are not affected by this setting, that discount is always taken at the end.
if yes, then all customer orders for this level will have $0 shipping charges on their order.

if yes, then all quantity discount tables (specified elsewhere) are applied on a product by product basis, based on quantity. Discounts are applied after extended price, or level discounted price is applied.
Level Discount Also Apply To Extended Prices
Level Has No Tax On Orders
Enter the name for this level (e.g. Reseller, Wholesaler, Platinum, Gold, Preferred, etc. Short names work best.

(Enter 0, or a percentage like 5 or 7.5) if non-zero, this each product price will be discounted by this amount for customers of this level. If Level Discounts also apply to extended prices is also checked, this discount percentage will ALSO be applied to any level specific extended prices. Generally, if you are going to the trouble of setting up extended pricing schemes, this percentage should be 0, and the extended prices should be the actual level price. If you don't want go to all the work of setting up extended prices for each product, this percentage discount is the best way to go to offer reseller/wholsale pricing to certain customers.

(Enter 0, or a dollar amount like 2.50 or 10.00) if non-zero, this amount will be subtracted from the entire order total, after all other criteria/discounts etc are applied. It will be unusual to apply this kind of level discount, but you can.

WARNING: You can easily define a pricing/level/extended pricing/quantity pricing/promotion scheme that NO ONE could possibly figure out how the actual pricing was computed. Our suggestion is to KEEP IT SIMPLE. If you use Discount Percents for levels, DON'T USE extended pricing, and TURN OFF promotions for the level, etc... If you want to define extended pricing for each product variant, then set ALL level discounts to 0, disallow promotions, etc... AspDotNetStorefront will ALWAYS compute a price for each product and the entire order, but YOU may not be able to explain how the price was arrived at to your customers. KEEP IT SIMPLE!

Enter all Dimension Fields or None of them
Your cost for this item.  This field is not required and is not used by AspDotNetStorefront, however it is useful if you wish to generate custom profitability reports.

If this item has a choice of colors, enter them here as a comma separated list (such as Red,Green,Blue).  If certain colors cost more than others, you can add a price modifier as well using square brackets,  For example, if Red costs $3.00 more than blue, you can enter the colors as Red[3.00],Blue.  If someone selects red, $3.00 will be added to the price.  DO NOT ENTER SPECIAL CHARACTERS SUCH AS AMPERSANDS OR SLASHES INTO COLOR NAMES.

If this item has colors and the SKU varies by color, enter a comma separated list of the sku modifiers here.  These will be added to the end of the SKU when a customer purchases this item/color combination.  For example, if you sell Red, Green, and Blue shirts, you could enter r,g,b here, and when this item is ordered in red, the sku would be 12345r (where "r" was the sku modifier you specified for red).
This setting is used by certain comparison shopping engines such as GoogleBase to categorize items.
Allows you to adjust the inventory on hand for this item.

If set to yes, the customer will be provided with a text box to enter the price they wish to pay for this item.  This is useful in situations where you want to allow customers to purchase gift cards for any amount or give donations through your website.
The message the customer will be shown asking what price they would like to pay.  For example, if this item is a donation, you might enter "Enter the amount you would like to donate" here.
Enter the WIDTH x HEIGHT x DEPTH as a decimal in INCHES in the format 0.00 x 0.00 x 0.00   For example, 6.5 x 10.0 x 12.75

If set to Yes, this item will be treated as a downloadable item. After purchase, customers will (depending on your configuration settings) be either manually or automatically sent an e-mail containing a download link for this product.

The RELATIVE path to your downloadable file.  For example, if the download is located at http://www.yoursite.come/download/MyDownload.exe, then you would enter "download/MyDownload.exe" here.  If you choose to place the file in your site's download directory, and your site's OrderDownloads folder is writable, the file will be copied to a unique location in the OrderDownloads directory before the link is sent, helping to prevent customers from guessing download links.
Indicate whether shipping for this item has a cost, is free, or is not required.

If you wish to manually upload images for your product using your own naming convention, enter the filename you wish this item to use in the preceding field.  This image must then be MANUALLY uploaded to your site's images/ProductVariant/{image size} directory.  The filename should not contain a path, but should be entered as "imagename.gif"
Determines whether or not tax will be calculated on this item.  If set to false, this item's price will be excluded from any tax computations.
Enter the minimum quantity of this item the customer is allowed to purchase.  They will not be allowed to purchase less than this amount.  If left blank, the customer may purchase any quantity.
The Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price for this item.  THIS VALUE IS NOT SHOWN TO THE CUSTOMER.

Enter the normal selling price for this item.  This is the price that customers will pay if the item is not on sale and the customer does not receive any special discounts (such as promotions or customer level discounts).

If set to yes, an order will be generated for this customer at the end of each recurring interval/interval type.  For example, if the interval is set to 1, and the interval type is set to Month, after one month (and everyn subsequent month thereafter until cancelled), an order will be generated for the customer until that customer cancels the recurring shipment through their account page.  Recurring orders are managed through the Orders menu.

Enter a comma separated list of quantities you want this item to be restricted to.  For example, if you enter 10,20 the customer will only have a choice of purchasing 10 or 20 of these items at a time.  Instead of a quantity textbox that allows them to enter any quantity, they will receive a dropdown list of the values you enter here.  If left blank, the customer will be able to choose whatever quantity they desire.
If you wish this item to be show as "On Sale" enter the sale price here.  If left blank, customers will pay the normal price.
When using Per Item shipping, this determines the cost the customer will be charged for shipping on this item.

If set to true, and when using realtime shipping, this option will send this item, include weight and dimensions, to the shipping provider as a separate package.  This is useful if you have large/bulky items that cannot ship in the same package as other items.

If this item has a choice of size, enter them here as a comma separated list (such as Small,Medium,Large,XLarge).  If certain sizes cost more than others, you can add a price modifier as well using square brackets,  For example, if XLarge costs $3.00 more than other sizes, you can enter the sizes as Small,Medium,Large,XLarge[3.00].  If someone selects XLarge, $3.00 will be added to the price.  DO NOT ENTER SPECIAL CHARACTERS SUCH AS AMPERSANDS OR SLASHES INTO SIZES.

If this item has sizes and the SKU varies by size, enter a comma separated list of the sku modifiers here.  These will be added to the end of the SKU when a customer purchases this item/size combination.  For example, if you sell Small, Medium, and Large shirts, you could enter s,m,l here, and when this item is ordered in medium, the sku would be 12345m (where "m" was the sku modifier you specified for medium).

If a value is specified for the Subscription Interval, when a customer purchases this item, the amount specified here will be added to the SubscriptionExpiresOn field in their customer record.  Subscriptions can be used to control access to topic pages, and can also be used for building custom membership-based sites.  This option can be used in conjunction with recurring billing to automatically extend customer subscriptions when they expire.

Enter the product weight as a decimal (0.00).  While this field defaults to POUNDS, you can change the weight unit in the Localization.WeightUnits setting.  Before changing this however, ensure your shipping carrier supports being sent weights using your chosen weight unit.

Number of products across the page

For display formats that use a grid, this setting determins how many columns are created before creating a new row.  To avoid breaking your skin, we recommend no more than 3 to 4 for this setting, and if you use large icon pictures, you may have to set this lower.

Determines how many sub-entities or products are displayed on a page when browsing this entity.  If there are more items in the entity than the page size, a page number block will be created so customers can navigate to additional pages.
The url for your distributor's website
AspDotNetStorefront allows you to run many different templates for your product group & sub-group set. Choose the template that best suits your needs for each product group.
If set to true, instead of being show a form to add this item to their cart, customers will see a prompt stating "Call to Order."
When using an XML Package that formats variants as a grid, this setting determines how many columns of variants are created before stating a new row.
Whether or not to display this product as a featured item on your home page
If set to true, the price of the item will not be shown on the product page.  Customers will have to add the item to their cart to see the price.
This determines how many variants are displayed on the product page.  If this number is exceeded, a paging control will be inserted at the top of the product page for navigation.

Enter a comma separated list of Product IDs that you wish to be shown in the "related products" section on the product page, or leave blank for no related products.  A related product might also be referred to as a substitute product.

If this item MUST be purchased in conjunction with another item(s), enter the Product ID(s) of the required item(s) here as a comma separated list.  If a customer adds this item to the cart and the other items are not in the cart as well, they will automatically be added.
If set to true, a text box is shown on the product page that must be filled in before the item can be added to the cart.  This is useful for products that require personalization such as engraving.
If disabled, customers will not be able to add this item to the cart as there will be no Add to Cart button.  This is useful if you are creating content pages.
If your product has a spec sheet (such as an external HTML file), enter the name of the spec sheet here.  Visit our manual for information on how and where to properly load the external spec sheet.

Setting this to true will enable you to enter inventory levels for every size/color combination this product's variants are available in. NOTE: If you have this on for a product, it is important to clear out the Inventory for the size/color combinations before turning this setting back off.

Enter a value to be used as the discount percentage, or leave blank for no discount.  If a value is entered here, if a customer chooses to add the upsell item(s) to the cart at the SAME TIME that they add the main product, the discount will be applied to the upsell items.

Upsell products (sometimes referred to as accessories or add-on products) can be entered here as a comma separated list of Product IDs.  Customers will have the option of checking a checkbox to add these items to the cart at the same time they add they add the main product they are viewing.

The product's weight, which defaults to pounds.  Enter as a decimal (example: 12.5).  You can change the default weight unit using the Localization.WeightUnits setting.  If a weight is set on a product variant, it will override this setting.
AspDotNetStorefront allows you to run many different templates for your product/variant set. Choose the template that best suits your needs for each product.

To use this function you must activate (set TRUE) the UseMappingShipToPayment setting. If this setting is not activated, the standard selection of payment methods will appear (which means ALL payment method will show for all shipping options). Also, if something in this mapping function will go wrong the original method will always be there as an backup function. No need to worry that NO payment options will appear in your customers browser.
Information to save into database if you update:

Shipping Methods

No matter whether you are charging real-time rates, or on some type of fixed rate basis, you are likely to want your shoppers to hurry things along by paying more. The 'shipping methods' allow you to set different speeds or different ways for goods to be shippied/collected. Once you have established different ways to deliver goods, then you can go on to work out how to charge for them.

When maintenance is finished running all users will be logged out (including you) and you will be redirected to the signin page.

This page helps you perform recommended monthly maintenance on your storefront database. You should run this late at night, probably on weekends, when site activity is minimal, as the store database could be locked for several minutes during these operations. It is recommended that you do this maintenance monthly.
Running this maintenance process will log out all users from the admin site, including the user running the maintenance
Purge all records that are marked as Deleted

Along with using this page to perform monthly maintenance operations on your storefront, you, or your hosting provider (whoever manages your server) should also be performing weekly full backups, daily incremental backups, virus monitoring, applying the latest security and service patches, and generally watching over the health of your database server. Those functions are not provided by our technical support team, as they are in the operations area of managing your business. You can contact your hosting provider for more information also on their policies and procedures.
If activated, all search logs will be cleared that are older than the # of days specified.

If activated, all shopping cart items will be cleared that are older than the # of days specified (wishlists and recurring orders not affected by this checkbox). If you wish to set the aging # days for all shopping carts, see Setting: AgeCartDays.
If activated, all wishlist items will be cleared that are older than the # of days specified.
If activated, product views older than the # of days selected will be cleared.
This will clear the RTShippingRequests and RTShippingResponses stored in the database.
If activated, all search logs will be cleared that are older than the # of days specified.

This option allows you to remove the customer credit card information (which is encrypted) from the Address records which are older than the # of days specified. The credit card information is almost never needed after an order has been successfully processed and shipped and then nothing has been heard back from the customer for 30 days. This does not affect the customer's main account record, and their credit card information remains in that account record, intact, in an encrypted state if Setting: StoreCCInDB is set to Yes.

Since order records contain a complete snapshot of all customer data, this option allows you to remove the customer credit card information (which is encrypted) from the order records which are older than the # of days specified. The credit card information is almost never needed after an order has been successfully processed and shipped and then nothing has been heard back from the customer for 30 days. This does not affect the customer's main account record, and their credit card information remains in that account record, intact, in an encrypted state if Setting: StoreCCInDB is set to Yes.

If checked, data for locales that no longer exist will be cleaned out of the LocalizedObjectName table.  Note that this only affects localization data used for the product and entity grids in the admin console.
If activated, profiles older than the # of days selected will be cleared.

If checked, the store will delete all customer records that belong to Anonymous customers. Anonymous customers are those who have added something to their cart (or take an action on the store which requires them to have a record in the Customer database table) but they have never registered, checked out, etc. These are records that can be safely deleted. If a purged Anonymous customer returns to the store later, they will simply get a new customer record automatically created for them.
This will permanently delete records in the database that are marked as deleted. Includes: Products, Entities, Topics, ShippingZones, SalesPrompts, Promotions, Affiliates, Customers, and Addresses.
Select this option if you want to save your settings for next time.

Select this option to tune the table indexes. Periodically, they can require some reorganization for maximum performance. If you select this option, your database may be locked for several minutes while the indexes are tuned.
Select this option to update database statistics used for optimizing SQL query run times.  This can cause monthly maintenance to take significantly longer to run on sites with lots of data.

Manage images for this product by image # and color. You can have up to 10 images for a product, and an image for each color, so this forms a 2 dimensional grid if images: image number x color. Each slot can have a separate picture. You should also load the image pic on the product page...that image is used by default for most page displays. These images are only used on the product page, when the user actively selects a different image number icon and/or color selection.

If this is checked, the site will try to apply the promotion to every customer's cart. Those who qualify based on the following promotion conditions (Discount, Limits, Requirements and Customer Targeting) will automatically get this discount.

This is an integer value (1,2,3,42, etc). If all promotions are the same priority, all applicable promotions are applied. If you have multiple promotions that would normally apply, for example a priority '1' promotion and priority '2' promotion, the higher priority '1' promotion will be applied. NOTE: Priority 0 means that the promo can always be combined with any other promotion!

This promotion will only be valid for users whose shipping address's zip code is specified in the comma separated list below. Users will need to enter an address BEFORE entering this promotion code.

Select the Create New or Reuse Catalog radio button.
These final two forms of calculation introduce the concept of distance by adding 'zones' to the methods that you will be establishing. Go here to setup your zones.

These calculations allow you to control the way the store calculates the cost of each order AND lets the shopper choose the 'method' (where method is most often about speed of shipping). If you choose one of these options then once you save your choice on this page then you must go here to create your own shipping methods.
In AspDotNetStorefront, the same basic premise is followed to calculate shipping for all orders. On this page you will choose your form of 'calculation'.
(You'll set a higher percentage as the shipping gets faster)
(One price per method regardless of what is being shipped)
This calculation does not offer the shopper any choice about the method of shipping (where method is most often 'speed'). Choose this if that suits your needs:
(This is the simplest, but the most work. You will need to edit every variant separately, assigning a shipping cost for each method)

This calculation charges the shopper using real time costs from one or more carriers of your choice. If you choose this option, AspDotNetStorefront will build the 'methods' for you as your shoppers require them. Don't expect to see any real-time methods until people begin to use the checkout. After that you can go here to see your shipping methods. Learn more about setting up real-time shipping here.

Regardless of the shipping calculation method in use, sometimes you want to offer free shipping on certain orders. AspDotNetStorefront helps by layering the following options over whichever calculation method you choose:
(The more expensive it is, and the faster it travels, the higher you're likely to set the cost)
(The heavier the order, and the faster it travels, the higher you're likely to set the cost)
This store has turned on the option to filter shipping over different domains, so settings on this page are for the selected store only.
(You'll setup zones. The more expensive the order is, and the further the customer's shipping zone, and the faster the order ships, the more you'll charge)
(Setup your shipping rates as a percentage of the customer's order total.)
(You'll setup zones. The heavier the order is, and the further the customer's shipping zone, and the faster the order ships, the more you'll charge)
Setup shipping methods to present to your customers during the shipping step of checkout.
